page.title: 04Education in Bournville
page.content: Our school, {Bournville Infants} was built 75 years ago, about 4 years after the{Junior School}next door. They were built by {Mr George Cadbury} because his wife, {Dame Elizabeth,} wanted the young children to have a local school without having to travel to Selly Oak or Kings Norton. We have a {special holiday} called {Founder's Day} on the last Friday in June each year to celebrate Dame Elizabeth' birthday. The two schools lie along one side of the{village green.}From the windows we can see St. Francis' Church and the shops. Some of the older children go to Dame Elizabeth {Secondary School} nearby in Woodbrooke Road opposite the yachting pool. Up the hill from our school, at the corner of The Green, is the{Art College}and running along the third side of The Green is {Bournville College of Education.}
